lead_paragraph: The Meadowlands has barred its leading trainer from the track after one of his horses tested positive for a banned drug after a race last month. The track announced yesterday that beginning with Wednesday's races, it will not accept entries from the trainer, Ken Rucker. Rucker's horse Highland Pride A, which won the eighth race at the Meadowlands on April 30, tested positive for erythropoietin, or EPO, a banned performance-enhancer.
